  • Method Details

    • getReal

      public boolean getReal()
      Checks if this Player is a real player or a bot.
      Returns:
      true if the player is real, false if it's a bot.

    • getID

      java.lang.String getID()
      Gets this player's name.
      Returns:
      a String representing this player's name.

    • placeShip

      void placeShip​(int ship, Position pos, Orientation o, Level level) throws CommandExecuteException
      Makes this Player place his Ship represented by an int index and checks if the player has been defeated.
      Parameters:
      ship - an int that represents the ship to be placed.
      pos - the Position of the ship to be placed.
      o - the Orientation of the ship to be placed.
      level - the Level of the game.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the ship cannot be placed correctly.

    • placeShip

      void placeShip​(Position pos, Orientation o, Level level) throws CommandExecuteException
      Makes this Player place his currentShip and checks if the player has been defeated.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position of the ship to be placed.
      o - the Orientation of the ship to be placed.
      level - the Level of the game.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the ship cannot be placed correctly.

    • attackShip

      boolean attackShip​(Position pos, Level level) throws CommandExecuteException
      Attempts to attack this player's ship. It also checks if the player has lost.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position that will be attacked.
      level - the Game level.
      Returns:
      true if any Ship has been sunk, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the attacked position is not valid.

    • equals

      boolean equals​(Player player)
      This method overwrites the equality comparator by comparing two players' names.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that will be compared.
      Returns:
      true if the two players have the same name, false otherwise.

    • place

      boolean place()
      Makes this Player place his boats. This method is overwritten by BotPlayer.place() if the player is a bot.
      Returns:
      false if the player is real, true otherwise.

    • attack

      boolean attack()
      Makes this Player attack. This method is overwritten by BotPlayer.attack() if the player is a bot.
      Returns:
      false if the player is real, true otherwise.

    • hasLost

      boolean hasLost()
      Checks if this Player has lost.
      Returns:
      true if the player has lost, false otherwise.

    • allShipsPlaced

      public boolean allShipsPlaced()
      Checks if this Player has placed his ships.
      Returns:
      true if the player has placed his ships, false otherwise.

    • receiveShot

      java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> receiveShot​(Position pos)
      Registers a shot at the given Position and changes the observable board used by instances of BotPlayer to perform their strategies.
      Parameters:
      pos - the position where the shot will be registered.
      Returns:
      a {@link List<>} containing exactly two Boolean values indicating if a Ship has been hit and if it has been sunk, respectively.

    • checkMiss

      boolean checkMiss​(Position p)
      Checks if a given Position is contained in the set of missed attacks upon this player.
      Parameters:
      p - the position to check.
      Returns:
      wether the position is contained in said set.

    • checkHit

      boolean checkHit​(Position p)
      Checks if a given Position is contained in the set of hit attacks upon this player.
      Parameters:
      p - the position to check.
      Returns:
      wether the position is contained in said set.

    • checkMissOrHit

      boolean checkMissOrHit​(Position p)
      Checks if a given Position is eiter in the set of hit attacks or in the set of missed attacks upon this player.
      Parameters:
      p - the position to check.
      Returns:
      wether the position is contained in any of said sets.

    • setLost

      public void setLost​(boolean b)

    • getState

      public org.json.JSONObject getState()
      Returns a JSONObject instance containing the following values:
      • name: a String indicating the player's name.
      • real: a Boolean value that indicates if the player is real.
      • data: the JSONObject returned by Fleet.getState().
      Returns:
      a JSONObject with said values.

    • parse

      public static Player parse​(org.json.JSONObject info, Level l, Game game) throws GameParseException, org.json.JSONException
      Given the information contained in a JSONObject, this method creates an instance of Player.
      Parameters:
      info - the JSONObject which contains the data.
      l - the Level that will be used to check if data is correct.
      game - the Game instance used to create the BotPlayer if the player is not real.
      Returns:
      the instance of Player with its attributes set according to the provided data.
      Throws:
      GameParseException - if the provided data contains incorrect or inconsistent values.
      org.json.JSONException - if the JSONObject doesn't contain all needed keys.

    • getDTO

      public PlayerDTO getDTO()
      Creates a PlayerDTO instance which has the same attributes as this instance of Player.
      Returns:
      a PlayerDTO created from this player.

    • setCurrentShip

      void setCurrentShip​(int i)
      Sets this players' fleet curretShip to be i.
      Parameters:
      i - an int representing the index of the ship in the fleet.

    • hasBeenDefeated

      boolean hasBeenDefeated()
      Checks if this Player has been defeated.
      Returns:
      true if the player has been defeated, false otherwise.
